story:
Short Summary

The smaller islands have been hit hard, flattened and damaged by salt water. THESE PEOPLE NEED WATER DESPERATELY! They will die if help does not get delivered. It's day 7 today!!
People living on remote islands of Vanuatu are having to drink harmful saltwater following last week's cyclone, Pam, which left Vanuatu in pieces with winds reaching 340kph, and 902 hpa.
  • 42,000 homes have been damaged.
  • 24 people have so far been confirmed dead and there are grave fears that this number will rise.
  • 70% of the country’s population of 267,000 have been displaced and that number is expected to rise as rescuers reach the outer islands.
  • 90% of the capital city is severely damaged.

What We Need

The funds we will raise will allow us to get 580 Lifestraws which we will equally distribute to cover 580 families with no access to clean water in the Islands of Tanna, Erromango, Shepherds, Tongoa, Epi, and Efate. 
If we don't reach our goal, whatever amount we will raise we will still use to buy Lifestraws to distribute to families.
http://www.buylifestraw.com/products/lifestraw-...

The Impact

This is an emergency situation.  Your contribution will be saving lives.  Every day, there are reports of people dying of dehydration.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help not just with contributions but also helping us spread the word out there. Please share our link in hopes that we would reach the right people who can help us reach our goal.

story: Hello my name is Daniel my wife Laura and I found out last year that we were expecting our first child. Needless to say we are extremely excited about bringing our child into this world. We found out that our baby was a girl and we decided to name her Rain. We began to prepare for her birth as all parents do; however this was stopped short when we found out that our little Rain has a congenital heart defect called truncus arteriosis. Truncus arteriosis is a very rare heart defect that is present at birth. It means that Rain has one large blood vessel that leads out of her heart. Normally, there are two separate vessels. In addition, the two lower chambers of the heart are missing a portion of the wall that divides them. As you can see Rain requires a lot of special care. Laura and I set out to find the best hospital to care for Rain and we found Nationwide Children’s Hospital located in Columbus, Ohio. This hospital is approximately 1500 miles from our home in Albuquerque, New Mexico. While Laura was still carrying Rain we traveled to the hospital to prepare for her birth. We are away from our family, our friends, and my job that supports us. Rain was born December 14, 2014 after 28 long hours of labor, she weighed 3 pounds. Tiny yet strong our little Rain is a fighter and she continues to fight every single day. At just 16 days old Rain suffered a cardiac arrest; thankfully she was able to fight her way back to us. We are facing many more surgeries and procedures to help save Rain. This is where you come in I have exhausted all of my resources and I am the sole provider for my family. I am not able to work at this time so that I can be with Laura and Rain. I need help, and I am reaching out to you to ask for it. No donation is too small and all donations are greatly appreciated. Please help us save our little Rain, she is our world. Thanks from family lobos

story:
New Stretch Goal Announced

Indiegogo gave us a few more days to meet and beat our fundraising goal. Let's see if we can get this project up to $20,000! With the additional $5,000 we will send Dr. Nell Bond back to Koinadugu to reunite with the local public health sector, carefully vet potential collaborators, recruit, hire, and train survivors, and then let the project loose! These additional funds are critical for ensuring the look and feel of the project stays true to our original intent. Can you help?!

*     *     *


Thank you for visiting! I'm Sarah and I'm convinced we can end the Ebola outbreak in West Africa. Over the past ten years, I have been studying emerging infectious diseases in Sub-Saharan Africa. This work allows me to make connections with doctors, researchers, community leaders, and social innovators from around the world. From these connections I assembled a Project Design Team, and we brainstormed a unique and powerful solution to West Africa's Ebola crisis.

Our idea was highlighted in the OpenIDEO Fighting Ebola Challenge sponsored by USAID.

Our goal is to stop the current Ebola epidemic and prevent future outbreaks.

While the rate of infections is thankfully slowing, Sierra Leone (a country half the size of Wisconsin) still has more than 500 new infections a month. Now is the time to buckle down and finish this.

How?

We start by identifying survivors. 

Research shows that survivors of Ebola are immune for up to ten years. This makes them ideal as first responders, because it lowers the risk of spreading the disease to caregivers. Then, we give them intensive training in Ebola response, and set them up with Responder Kits (gloves, gowns, buckets, and bleach). The final step as Ebola responders is to establish a direct link between survivors and access to advanced care and treatment. 

Ebola survivors will also be trained in community public health service and mobilization, making both immediate and long-term service opportunities available.


Where?

Our work will begin in the Koinadugu District, Sierra Leone. 



Who?

An in-country partnership with the Ministry of Health in Koinadugu District is in the works!  This is a key partner for ensuring the sustainability of the project.  Visit the Koinadugu District City Council webpage to learn more about a dynamic and committed group of leaders in a very rural area.

When?

We are ready for rapid implementation.  With your contribution we will recruit and train the inaugural 3-5 members of the Ebola Survivors Corps as soon as April 1, 2015!

Time to get involved!

Our fundraising goal is $15,000. All of the work being done by the Project Design Team is pro bono; and all the funds raised will go straight into the project (no overhead, US-based salaries, institutional fees, etc). All contributions will be directed to our nonprofit fiscal partner. All donors will receive a tax-deduction receipt shortly after the campaign winds up (March 20, 2015).  

  1. The first $5,000 will be used to cover the salary of 3-5 Ebola Survivors for one year.
  2. The next $5,000 is dedicated to training and infection control supplies stock-up. 
  3. The final $5,000 will be used to support the operations of the Ebola Survivor Corps throughout the year.  This includes expenses such as mobile phone minutes, internet connection, transportation, community health outreach, and Ebola prevention PSAs.
  4. LET'S STRETCH OURSELVES AND RAISE ANOTHER $5000 TO SEND DR. NELL BOND BACK TO KOINADUGU TO LAUNCH THE PROJECT IN PERSON!


New African Perks Announced- 

$ 75 - LARGE African Print Fabric.African fabric is well-known for its bright and eclectic design elements. The 4 pieces we just received as perks are 6 yards long and gorgeous! These are going fast! (we are down to 3. #4 just sold)

(THIS ONE IS MY FAVORITE- IMAGINE A BLAZER WITH A HUGE BLUE PEACOCK ON THE BACK. TOO COOL)


$ 30 - SMALL African Print Fabric.  African fabric is well-known for its bright and eclectic design elements. The 4 pieces we just received as perks are 2 yards long and gorgeous! These are going fast! (#6 has sold)

$ 60 - YELLOW AND GREEN QUILTED TOTE FROM SOUTH AFRICA This gorgeous tote bag was made by a women's collective in South Africa. The  bright yellow and green fabrics and cushiony quilt make this an ideal tote for carrying a bottle of Pinot Gris and  a couple of plastic wine glasses to the lake, so you can toast the coming of spring as you watch the sun set.

SOLD OUT!


$55 each- Bold Paper-bead and glass bead necklaces.  These hand-made beaded necklaces are straight from the continent. The beads are made by meticulously cutting, rolling, dying, and varnishing paper.  The red strand is 36 inches with a really pretty metal hook;  the multi-colored strands with varying sizes of paper and glass beads are 48 inches with no hook.  (ONLY RED REMAINS!)


$55 - Ankole Cow Horn Necklace- This necklace is hand-made from polished cow horn of the famous Ankole cattle region of southwest Uganda.  Its wire base fixes the horn at the base of the neck for a very flattering look.  Only 1 available. Don't let this pass you by/buy!  

SOLD OUT! 


$35 each- Tiny Papyrus Baskets  These are the sweetest little hand-made baskets you will find. They are perfect for stashing earrings or storing quarters.  They are 3 inches tall with their lids, and 2 inches wide at their widest spot.  Let us know if you have a preference in color.



Perks!

 $10 - Cool Craft Beer. Local perk for Madison, WI. Receive a drink chip from The Blue Moon Bar and Grill that will entitle you to try any of their 14 taps, including rare and limited releases, some of which have been cellared for over a year!  

SOLD OUT! 

$ 25 - Ebola Survivor Corps Poster. Receive an 11x17 poster of the Ebola Survivor Corps card to hang proudly in your home or office! This colorful image encompasses our commitment to exploring all avenues in the search for answers, and is a beautiful addition to any wall!

$50 - Self on a Shelf. Contribute $50 and we will incorporate your photo into a welcoming collage which will greet every person who enters the Ebola Survivors office in Sierra Leone. You care, and you deserve to be recognized for that!

$100 - Home and Away. We will send you the Ebola Survivor Corps poster; take your picture holding it, so we can feature you as a centerpiece of the collage at the Ebola Survivors office in Sierra Leone!

$10,000 - Butcher Training. Spend time with David Gathy at The Conscious Carnivore (Madison, WI) and learn how to break down whole hogs into delicious parts, cure bacon, smoke hams. A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to learn one-on-one with a master butcher!

If you can't contribute financially to this project, you can still make a difference! Let's get the word out and let people know about the importance of this project. The media may have turned its attention to the next big story, but that doesn't mean the outbreak is over.  Now is the time to really dig in and see this through to the end!

Use the Indiegogo share tools and share our campaign with every single person you know or have ever met.

Project Design Team:

  • Dr. Sarah Paige — Health Geographer 
  • Ms. Carly Malave — Microbiology Undergraduate
  • Mr. Casey Chapman — Writer, Fundraiser & Management Expert in Madison, WI
  • Mr. Andrew Bennett — Molecular Biologist
  • Dr. Michelle Verant — Wildlife Veterinarian
  • Ms. Sagan Friant — Disease Ecologist
  • Dr. Krista Milich — Biological Anthropologist
  • Ms. Aleia McCord — Co-founder of Waste2Energy
  • Dr. Lina Moses — Epidemiologist in Kenema, Sierra Leone
  • Ms. Nell Bond — Environmental Epidemiologist, Tulane Univ. and Sierra Leone
  • Mr. Douglas Haugen — Content Producer, Web Presence

story:
Donate anonymously with bitcoin: 1Hj1Fye1hSc6ocA6CfitWgAzyciZkL3rBX


The vision of Brian Byrne, I Mother Earth lead singer and avid MMA practitioner and Jon Foster, former fighter, current MMA gym owner/coach OSS Mentality is a business based on helping fighters help fighters. providing a positive force in the
world of combat sports.

OSSMentality.com will host a live one on one videoconferencing platform for taking martial arts lessons or getting advice from other MMA related pros such as BJJ or boxing instructors, strength and conditioning coaches, nutritionists, sport psychologists etc. In a nutshell we are creating both an online community for combat sports fans and athletes and an alternate source of income for fighters and other industry experts.

When you do anything through OSSMENTALITY.COM you will be giving back to the fighters who drive this entire industry. 10% of all profits earned through OSS Mentality will be donated to the OSS Mentality Fighters Fund. A fund exclusively set up to help support combat sports athletes in need.

OSS - to persevere when pushed, never give up, have determination, grit and withstand the most arduous of training.

OSS can be used as an introductory to your opponent (to begin a fight) and/or to conclude a match as a genuine display of respect. As a sign of respect to your sensei or ‘professor’ for having taken the time to demonstrate a move or to ‘sign-off’ from a hard training day.
 OSS can be used as an introductory to your opponent (to begin a fight) and/or to conclude a match as a genuine display of respect. As a sign of respect to your sensei or ‘professor’ for having taken the time to demonstrate a move or to ‘sign-off’ from a hard training day.


We need your help to raise $30,000 so we can continue to work on making OSS Mentality, a positive force in the combat sports world a reality! 

By contributing to our IndieGOGO campaign you are helping to:

• Finish development, launch and maintain the ossmentality.com website and online teaching/consulting platform. This also includes web hosting and bandwidth.

• Develop the OSS Mentality online store where you can buy kickass products.

• Pay creative freelancers (branding, website design, marketing materials etc.)

• Marketing/outreach. This is huge! Without exposure through marketing OSS Mentality may not reach the people who would love to purchase lessons online from pro fighters or get pro nutrition advice that can take them to the next level and help industry pros earn extra income. Without funding for outreach OSS Mentality is limited in how and who we can recruit as instructors.


$10 -THE FAN— You get to know you did something good! 


$25 -THE CASUAL ATHLETE— An Oss Mentality sticker set, OSS Mentality gi patch, 10% off your next HEADRUSH purchase at headrushbrand.com and your choice of a 10% discount off your next HAYABUSA purchase at hayabusafight.com or ROCKWELL WATCHES watch at store.rockwellwatches.com.

$50 -THE AMATEUR— An Oss Mentality sticker set, OSS Mentality gi patch, 10% off your next HEADRUSH purchase at headrushbrand.com and your choice of a 20% discount off your next HAYABUSA purchase at hayabusafight.com or ROCKWELL WATCHES watch at store.rockwellwatches.com.


$100 -THE PRO— An Oss Mentality sticker set, gi patch, An Oss Mentality t-shirt, 10% off your next HEADRUSH purchase at headrushbrand.com and your choice of a 30% discount off your next HAYABUSA purchase at hayabusafight.com or ROCKWELL WATCHES watch at store.rockwellwatches.com.

$250 -THE LEGEND— An Oss Mentality sticker set, Oss Mentality gi patch, Oss Mentality t-shirt, a 50% discount on your first online lesson or consultation at ossmentality.com, 10% off your next HEADRUSH purchase at headrushbrand.com, a VANE Mouthguard and a 40% discount off your next HAYABUSA purchase at hayabusafight.com or ROCKWELL WATCHES watch at store.rockwellwatches.com.


$1000 -THE HALL OF FAMER— An Oss Mentality sticker set, an Oss Mentality gi patch, an Oss Mentality t-shirt, an Oss Mentality hoodie, a 50% discount on your first 2 online lessons or consultations at ossmentality.com, , 10% off your next HEADRUSH purchase at headrushbrand.com, a VANE MOUTHGUARD and a 40% discount off your next HAYABUSA purchase at hayabusafight.com and your next ROCKWELL WATCHES watch purchase at store.rockwellwatches.com.


• 10 Rockwell Watches (watch will be a CF or ROOK model, images below are examples only)

 

• 14 Hayabusa Pro BJJ Gis 

• 1 Nutrition Consultation with Erin McDougall, RD of Designed Nutrition. 

• 1 Mental Mental Performance Coaching Session with Danny Patterson MSW, RSW Certified Life Coach of Full Potential Health Wellness Performance Coaching and Consulting Services.

• OSS Mentality T-Shirt! Be one of the chosen few to own an original T from our first run produced!


• OSS Mentality Snap Back Ball Cap! It wont look like a web mockup with an embroidered logo and your obviously intelligent dome under it! 

The fight business is an uncertain, difficult, and dangerous place to make a living. Income can come in bursts and then disappear for months. Training and equipment can be expensive and injuries are common. Fights get cancelled, opponents drop out and your livelihood is dependent on you being able to fight.

OSS Mentality has been created with the goal of helping pro and amateur fighters. By supporting Oss Mentality you are helping to facilitate an alternative source of income for combat sports athletes and industry related experts.


We will be the first ever in this industry to host live one on one video conferencing with participating fighters, coaches, nutritionists, managers, doctors, agents, potential sponsors and so on. These people can set their own schedule, rates, and frequency. OSS Mentality facilitates the entire process from scheduling and providing the video platform to online payments! Securely and easily.


Also when you do anything through OSSMENTALITY.COM you will be giving back to the fighters who drive this entire industry. They are the reason this exists.

Every time a coach, fighter, nutritionist etc. uses OSSMentality.com to teach a lesson, give advice, run through techniques etc. 80% goes to the person teaching, and 20% goes to facilitate OSS Mentality


Get the information you want

Browse available lessons, sport psychology sessions, expert advice etc.

Intuitive Booking

Using our automated online system you select what dates and times work best for your schedule.

Online Payments

Once you select a suitable day and time for your lesson you can pay online all in one seamless experience.

Support Fighters

OSS Mentality pledges to support fighters with sponsorships at our highest possible 


  • If you can not contribute financially relax, it's cool. You can still help out! Every time you mention OSS Mentality online through your Facebook, Twitter or other social media accounts you are helping spread the word and expose possible students to the instructors at OSS Mentality!
  • Do you train already? Do you know a good dietician, Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu or Yoga instructor? Tell them about OSS Mentality! We are always looking for new talented instructors and experts who can help grow the available knowledge base at OSS Mentality.
  • And of course use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you! Jon & Brian

story:
Arizona State Men’s 7’s Rugby team have been on a year-long journey to reach the national tournament. The dream began in August at training camp- in the 100 degree + heat of Tempe, Arizona, the boys worked tirelessly to condition themselves for competition against the nation’s elite. After 3 major tournaments in California and huge wins against storied opposition such as UCLA, St. Mary’s, and rival University of Arizona, they found themselves ranked 3rd in the nation. Waiting with baited breath, they were given an at-large birth to the USA Rugby College 7’s National Championship. As a team, this was a dream come true; however, as a self-funded club sport, it was a new challenge presented to the squad. We are looking to raise $6,000 to pay for travel expenses and rooming accommodations for our 15 man roster and Coach Gregor.

If you are a fan of the Sun Devils, or just love the ambitious dream that takes athletes to the top, please make a donation of your choosing; it’s something we won’t soon forget.

story:
Hello! We are the InterVarsity Matador Christian Fellowship Team that is helping to raise funds for the the Cloud & Fire Ministries "Race it Forward 2015" race.

 InterVarsity is a National and International organization that is dedicated to reaching out to students on college campuses in following Jesus and empowering world changers. “Race it Forward 2015” is an opportunity to run for a greater purpose which the InterVarsity chapter at California State University is looking forward to partnering with!

"Cloud & Fire Ministries works with at-risk youth, helping them complete their education, gain vocational skills and become leaders in the community.  Every young person at Cloud & Fire hears that they are created for a purpose, and are given the opportunity to transform their lives through our programs."

Cloud & Fire has the goal to raise between 5,000 to 10,000 dollars from this race. We as a team have the goal of reaching 500 dollars. All of the donations will be going to fulfill their mission of helping at risk youth further their personal, professional, and emotional success.

One of the challenges that we are having to overcome is the need to do this campaign quickly. The race is May 2nd, but we are confident that we will reach our goal! This is where we are asking you to help contribute to our team. In donating, you will be helping further their mission. We would also appreciate it if you spread the word to friends, family, social media, work. etc. The more people know the closer we will get to reaching our goal of helping them.

story:
I have grown up in a natural environment surrounded by tradition and morals. I got a university degree in the Science of Maths and a master in MBA in International Business in UK. 

My goal is to expand and promote the fresh products of my home industry and familiarize prospectives customers with unigue taste and quality.

Therefore, by contributing to this idea products unknown up to present time, will be known worldwide.

My primary goal is 30.000 US$ to :

  • Renovate the small premises of the excisting local industry
  • Purchase the necessary basic machinery and equipment
  • Get final official government permission recquired
  • Make marketing and promotional activities
Our products are totally fresh, exclusively homemade, completely natural, coming from the fertile soil and the crystal clear sea of the island and therefore, all the ingredients used are organic. 
You are all invited to come and make the products together. It will be one of your best lifetime experience. 
The asking fund is the least possible to achieve this goal and I am sure that your contributions will help us proceed with it.
See yourself. Taste. Smell.
Offers...
1. One jar of salt bloom (500 gram) and two bottles of Lemonchelo liquer (500 ml)
     at the of 30 US$.
2. One jar of salt bloom (500 gram) and four bottles of Lemonchelo liquer (500 ml) 
     at the of 60 US$.
We will be thankful to receive your contribution.

story:
For those of you who know my wife Terri and I, you might have heard us say when we got married 25 years ago and went to Negril in Jamaica, we met a special guy named Crooksy.
Crooksy was a local carving artist that we enjoyed spending time with during our honeymoon, We arranged private tours through him and his friends who all took very good care of us.
We never forgot Crooksy and kept his picture in our wedding album all these years.

        

This is Crooksy over 25 years ago carving a bull for us and is Terri also over 25 years ago watching him working on our carving.

We decided last fall to return to Negril for our 25th anniversary and we wanted to find Crooksy after all these years. When we arrived, I put the name out on the beach to see if anyone knew him and found out he was very well know still and well liked by all. We told them our story and asked them to go find him and tell him we wanted to see him.

Crooksy came to see us on the beach the very next day. What an experience after all those years. It was truly amazing to find and old friend. What are the odds?

Croosky now 77 years old and his wife of over 40 years Cynthia is 60 years old. They still had their shop across the street at the little market called Rutland Point Crafters Market.

We spent quite a lot of time with them and to find out the market was struggling with competition now on the beach and a much worse issue, Cynthia was diagnosed with Cancer.

They did not know the total prognosis because they did not have the money for her to go to Montego Bay to see the doctor and get the results and recommendations for treatment.

We gave them money right then and said go tomorrow which she did. When she came back the next day they showed me the letter from the hospital outlining her Cancer and recommended treatment. They did not understand and could not read the medical jargon in that letter. Croosky told me in Jamaica many people just die from Cancer because they cannot afford treatment. After reading the letter and doing my best to decipher what she had and that she needed radiation, Terri and I decided to forgo our Christmas presents to each other and help pay for her travel and medical costs to make her well again.

Cynthia is not just just a great lady but she is also raising her 10 year old granddaughter full time and another granddaughter part time. My point is, this lady gives to everyone selflessly and is very needed in many ways. This was another reason why helping her was so important to us.

Cynthia travelled back and forth from Negril to Montego Bay almost every day for 6 weeks and several times a week for another 4 or 5 weeks to get tests and get 20 rounds of radiation treatment. I emailed the doctor and stayed in touch and let him know this lady was struggling with costs and we were trying to help. They actually helped her get some treatment at no cost and gave her credit to get through all the treatment needed. In all this time her business at the market was also not earning any money with all this time and effort focused on her travelling to Montego Bay.

We donated a small website for their market to help bring more visitors which they say has helped: Rutland Point Crafters Market www.rutlandpoint.com

In total Terri and I have donated in excess of $1,500 ourselves and the Rotary club I am part of graciously held a raffle to help and raised another $600.

We are pleased to say at this point Cynthia is being told the Cancer appears to be gone and will need to have more tests and follow up checkups. At this point we need to raise another $1,000 to help her pay off approximately $300 US to existing medical costs, another $200 for further testing and checkups, $100 US for travel to get back and forth to Montego Bay and at least another $200US to take the pressure off and help them get their bills at home caught up and get them back on their feet again. In Canadian dollars this is approximately $1,000 and that is why we are reaching out to those who know us and others who would like to help in a good cause to raise this amount.

We are not suggesting you donate a large amount, even $20 helps if we get enough people.

Thank you for reading this and considering to help us in what has been a very important personal commitment in our lives to selflessly help someone else.

story:
Short Summary

Hi friends!  We are the midwives of Central Florida and we are reaching out to our community of supporters for help with an incredible, very exciting, and bigger-than-ever campaign for out-of-hospital birth RIGHT HERE in Central Florida!  Billboards promoting the SAFETY of out-of-hospital birth have never before been seen by the public in Greater Orlando.  

We, YOUR midwives, have decided it's time to come together and make this happen!  We need ALL of you, our community of out-of-hospital birth supporters, to contribute towards this project so we can get these billboards up by this May!  YOUR contribution will make this message reach the largest & widest audience it EVER has in Central Florida!  We are gratefully asking you to help us with this project! Please give up your Starbuck runs this week ;-) and help the midwives fund these billboards!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000 in the next 30 days to get the billboards up all across Central Florida!  It is a big goal!  We need your help with this initial expense.  The midwives are contributing separately in order to keep these billboards up for at least 4 months.  It is a big expense because we are all individual small practices compared to the large hospitals and their ad campaign budgets.

ALL of your contributions will go directly towards this initial expense to get the billboards up in multiple zip codes throughout Central Florida.  We came up with some contribution levels and some small, but meaningful, "perks" (Facebook shout-outs, lunch with the midwives, a lovely henna party, etc) to show our community of out-of-hospital birth supporters our genuine gratitude for supporting us and helping this BIG idea come to fruition.  We humbly hope that you are ALL willing to contribute at these levels so we can make a large-scale impact here in our Central Florida community.

The Impact

Having a campaign such as this right here in Central Florida will finally work to change the perception of out-of-hospital birth to one that includes SAFETY and GOOD outcomes.  We know that out-of-hospital birth statistics are backed by sound evidence and we feel it's time to boldly take that message to the public in a very visible way.  Hospital corporations spend tens of thousands of dollars each year on advertising their safety and care.  Your contribution will help us make a *real* impact in saying that Out-Of-Hospital Birth ALSO = SAFETY & GOOD OUTCOMES!

We are not doing this alone, we have partnered with Cristen Pascucci, national birth advocate and vice president of the Improving Birth organization and founder of Birth Monopoly, to help with this very important and impactful campaign.  With her help, we are ready to position Greater Orlando as a leader in out-of-hospital birth as we have one of the highest concentrations of midwives in the state.  

We strongly feel the women & families of Central Florida should have easy access to out-of-hospital birth statistics and evidence-based information.  To do this we are working on a brand-new, comprehensive website specifically focused for Central Florida that will include the research to back our message as well as provide a local out-of-hospital provider directory.  This website will go live before May and will be up on every billboard.  

Imagine for a moment that you're driving down the road and in addition to seeing a big hospital billboard, you see a billboard promoting out-of-hospital birth and midwifery care!  You see these billboards every day on your drive positioned in various zip codes throughout Central Florida!  Imagine the joy you will feel, as passionate birth and women advocates, to know that all the other cars driving next to you, in front of you, and behind you are seeing the same thing!  It's time...it's time!

Challenges

We are well aware that there are out-of-hospital birth opponents that may take this opportunity to delude the public about statistics and about what licensed midwives do.  We plan to boldly make the statement that most of these claims are based on a single, flawed study (the Wax paper) that does not accurately represent "planned" out-of-hospital birth with "licensed" practitioners.  We feel in integrity with our profession, serving our community as Florida Licensed Midwives, and we no longer wish to stand in the shadows of misconceptions and misinformation.  Our safety & outcomes are backed by sound evidence and our model of care has the best maternal & infant mortality statistics across the globe!

More Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word about the Central Florida Out-of-Hospital Birth Billboard campaign by sharing it with EVERYONE!  Your passion and excitement will be contageous and it will help generate buzz around what we're doing here!  We have the next 30 days to raise these funds.  We humbly and gratefully ask that you please SHARE this on Facebook and Twitter as many times as you can with as many 'groups' and 'pages' as you can!

We are not doing this alone, we have partnered with Cristen Pascucci, national birth advocate and vice president of the Improving Birth organization and founder of Birth Monopoly, to help with this very important and impactful campaign.  With her help, we are ready to position Greater Orlando as a leader in out-of-hospital birth as we have one of the highest concentrations of midwives in the state.  
We strongly feel the women & families of Central Florida should have easy access to out-of-hospital birth statistics and evidence-based information.  To do this we are working on a brand-new, comprehensive website specifically focused for Central Florida that will include the research to back our message as well as provide a local out-of-hospital provider directory.  This website will go live before May and will be up on every billboard.  
Imagine for a moment that you're driving down the road and in addition to seeing a big hospital billboard, you see a billboard promoting out-of-hospital birth and midwifery care!  You see these billboards every day on your drive positioned in various zip codes throughout Central Florida!  Imagine the joy you will feel, as passionate birth and women advocates, to know that all the other cars driving next to you, in front of you, and behind you are seeing the same thing!  It's time...it's time!   Challenges We are well aware that there are out-of-hospital birth opponents that may take this opportunity to delude the public about statistics and about what licensed midwives do.  We plan to boldly make the statement that most of these claims are based on a single, flawed study (the Wax paper) that does not accurately represent "planned" out-of-hospital birth with "licensed" practitioners.  We feel in integrity with our profession, serving our community as Florida Licensed Midwives, and we no longer wish to stand in the shadows of misconceptions and misinformation.  Our safety & outcomes are backed by sound evidence and our model of care has the best maternal & infant mortality statistics across the globe!   More Ways You Can Help Please help us spread the word about the Central Florida Out-of-Hospital Birth Billboard campaign by sharing it with EVERYONE!  Your passion and excitement will be contageous and it will help generate buzz around what we're doing here!  We have the next 30 days to raise these funds.  We humbly and gratefully ask that you please SHARE this on Facebook and Twitter as many times as you can with as many 'groups' and 'pages' as you can!

story:
4Another...

My name is John McKay and I am one of the founders of 4Another, a 501-c3 non-profit that was created to help make a difference in childhood cancer awareness.  I helped found this organization in honor of my Mom, who lost her fight with brain cancer after surgery, radiation, and chemo in July of 2012.

We are planning a cross country run this summer to be completed in about 109 days beginning on June 20.  There are two primary runners, and we hope that we will be joined each day by local peeps out to support their community and make a difference in an adventurous way.  

Along the way we will be visiting heroes in hospitals, lending support to families and helping out with fundraisers for local foundations and families in need.  People will be able to go to our website and dedicate a day on the road for their hero, and will be able to track our progress on the road and join us for some miles themselves if they so choose.

It will take something from everyone to change the way childhood cancer research is funded

We are currently seeking corporate sponsorships and hope to fund all of the expenses on the road in this manner so that 100% of the money raised on tour can be donated to children's cancer research.  Nobody on the team is making any type of salary in this venture and we are adamant about keeping costs on the road down, so we will be camping in our vehicle most of the time.

The TOUR BUS is what we are trying to fund here.  We are planning on one that sleeps six so that we can accommodate people who would like to join us for a few days wherever they may be along our route.

We have a couple of retired Navy Captains who are eager to help modify the inside of a used RV, and our search has led us to believe that we can begin our journey for about $5000.


PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE:   4another.net   for more information about childhood cancer


Make a difference

Your contribution will be providing the vehicle necessary to make the big trip from Virginia Beach, Virginia to Los Angeles, California.  We will use the tour bus to promote and spread awareness before the tour begins at hospitals, events and fundraisers as well.
The entire vehicle will be wrapped with contributing sponsor logos and the logos of countless child cancer foundations across the country.  These foundations will be able to share their information through our website and gain exposure as we traverse the nation.  It is our hope and plan to help unite and rally the village of support for childhood cancer and expose the problem with funding research to those not directly involved.  Although not everyone is capable of talking about a small child with cancer, we all have gifts to share.
Someone could:  run 4 another, walk 4 another, eat 4 another, swim 4 another, make gifts 4 another, read 4 another, bike 4 another, do yoga 4 another, and however else someone might like to participate.
We are all a part of the village.  
There are many things that we all can do "4Another"!


Risks & Challenges

We have just begun our attempt to secure corporate sponsorship to pay for the trip expenses.  We have a number of interested parties and hope to move on to raising money for research well before the start date of June 20th arrives.

This will not be the first time that I have run across the country with a team.  I was part of a three man team that ran from coast to coast in 2013 and raised $103,000 for sarcoma cancer research.  This endeavor was brand new for all of us, but we were able to have some success, and I feel like a few positive changes in the way we run things will add to that.


Other Ways You Can Help

As I stated earlier, there are limitless ways that someone could help out and make a difference 4 another.  

Sharing and talking up the adventure is a great way to get others in the know.  

Check out our web page, and like our Facebook page.  

Take a look at the route map on both pages and start to think about where you would like to meet us on the road and give a few miles.  We will be posting an exact schedule as soon as we can and will do our best to stay prompt while touring.  We hope to have daily participation and include members of the military, schools, clubs, etc.

We are also planning to stop in the middle of each day and practice yoga, to center ourselves and restore our bodies for the coming miles and smiles, maybe you would like to join us for a few oms.

story:
Short Summary

Today on the drive home from the gym I was starving and tempted to get Mc Donald's drive-thru. But I resisted, and I started thinking - WHY THE HELL AREN'T THERE ANY HEALTHY DRIVE-THRU restaurants?

Drive-thru has been around since 1947 yet there isn't any healthy drive-thru. No one seems to be doing anything to change that, so I'm going to try. I can do it, with your help.

I'm a 30 year old entrepreneur from Western Australia. I already run a successful online business, so have some idea of how to go about this. The plan is simple - develop a healthy menu, find the best location (based on where the most money donated comes from), set-up and see how it goes. I'm doing this because I want to be able to get healthy drive-thru food, not to make money. As such - anyone who funds this will get store credit. I may not be able to pay it back with free food immediately, but the idea is to do it eventually - the money you invest you will get back in healthy delicious food!

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need money in order to create the first restaurant.
  • All $ invested will be returned via restaurant credit - basically free food to the value of your investment.
  • The vision is to make this international - as accessible and convenient as Mc Donald's.

Menu

There isn't one - yet.
Think high protein, low-carb. Burritos, tacos, salads, Quorn, hard boiled eggs, tuna, spinach, kale, beans, lentils etc. Food inspired by the '4 Hour Body'

The Impact

The impact of this is obvious I think - if like me you never have enough time in a day and are easily influenced by driving past fast food restaurants - you will now have a healthy alternative.

Risks & Challenges

This campaign has been put up to gauge interest and see if it would be worthwhile to start. I would love to do this and would commit to it 100% if I get the funding. So far I have spent nothing on this but my time.

This is a serious campaign - the picture may look like a joke but believe me it's not.. I'm just not a graphic designer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If anyone else is interested in helping out, whether you're an entrepreneur, want to be one or just have ideas for meals - get in touch.

story:
Help advance promising research to prevent breast cancer


Read about us in the Marin IJ

Within Marin County, California, a population with extremely high breast cancer rates, we have identified a subgroup of women who do not get breast cancer. This campaign funds the next step towards understanding the mechanism of this protection, with the ultimate objective of devising a breast cancer prevention strategy applicable to all women.

"Preventing breast cancer is the single most important thing we can do in terms of breast cancer research. Until now, there haven’t been enough truly promising leads. We owe it to all women to build on these findings."

Francine Halberg, MD
Radiation Oncologist
Marin Cancer Institute

Breast cancer rates are increasing worldwide, and there are now almost 2 million new cases every year. We need to move this research forward as quickly and as efficiently as possible. The next step of our research plan is ready to go, and costs have been minimized by eliminating administrative overhead, and by our researchers working on this project without compensation.

The Project is being led by Mark Powell, MD, MPH who worked for 10 years as a researcher for the Marin Women's Study, a large breast cancer study funded by the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) and the Avon Foundation. He was the Principal Investigator for 5 years on Avon-funded studies that identified women with naturally occurring breast cancer protection, and has identified a key gene that is critical to the process. The current proposed study is a collaboration between Dr. Powell and Dr. Christopher Benz, Director of the Cancer & Developmental Therapeutics Program at the Buck Institute for Research on Aging, and will be performed in the California Teachers Study (CTS) with the help of Dr. Peggy Reynolds, Senior Researcher at the CTS. The Project Team includes public health professionals, community organizations, advocates, survivors, oncologists, statisticians, epidemiologists, and academic researchers working together to find a solution.

“Dr. Powell and Dr. Benz have come up with an amazing finding that occurs during pregnancy in a subgroup of women. My greatest hope going forward is that all women have an equal chance of being breast cancer free in their lifetime.”

Janice Barlow, RN
Executive Director
Zero Breast Cancer

Our work has found that women who develop high blood pressure during pregnancy and have a specific gene do not get breast cancer later in life. This can be understood by thinking of a door with 2 different locks. Having only 1 key will not get you inside, you must have both keys. The hypertension these women develop in pregnancy is not thought to play a direct role, but is a marker for pregnancies in which the placenta does not develop properly. This results in an outpouring of metabolic and growth factors designed to save the pregnancy. These substances, in the presence of the specific gene variation, have a critical effect on breast tissue, rendering it resistant to developing breast cancer later in life. By understanding how this happens naturally in these women, we can develop strategies to mimic this process in all women. 

Good science, especially when there is a potential breakthrough finding, requires validation of the findings in another population by different researchers.  We have received preliminary approval to have our findings validated in the California Teachers Study (CTS), which has over 130,000 participants and is one of the largest studies in the nation. Unfortunately, government agencies do not fund validation studies, creating a paradoxical situation where they don’t fund you if you haven’t validated your findings, yet won’t fund your validation study. Thus, our first goal is to raise $60,000 to complete the validation study, which will also expand upon our findings due to the richness of the CTS database with its extensive information on multiple genes involved in key pathways.

Please help us move this research forward. With over 500,000 worldwide deaths yearly from breast cancer, we cannot stand by and rely on the archaic and painfully slow government grant system, which currently spends less than 10% on research directed toward prevention. We must do all we can as quickly as possible!

“What’s been a very interesting spin-off of the Marin Women’s Study has been finding that some women can actually be protected from breast cancer. We think with this biological clue we can design new and very innovative breast cancer prevention strategies that could be be applied to all women.”

Christopher Benz, MD
Buck Institute for Research on Aging

BUDGET:


STRETCH GOALS:

$120,000:  Obtain 150 breast tissue specimens from the Komen Tissue Bank from women with and without a history of pregnancy-induced hypertension, and DNA from their blood. This will include proper matching of cases and controls, all necessary data for analyses, and copies of available mammograms.

$180,000:  Perform microscopic and immuno-histochemical analysis of the breast tissue to identify differences in total and activated IGF1R expression, and microscopic examination of epithelium, fat, and stromal constituents in women with and without natural breast cancer protection as differentiated by SNP analyses (begin to identify the differences in the breast tissue of women with naturally occurring breast cancer protection).

$240,000:  This will enable RNA extraction from breast tissue samples and microarray RNA analysis using the Agilent or Affymetrix platforms to enable more complete genome transcriptome analyses, permitting determination of an activated gene signature score (more definition of the differences at a cellular/molecular level).

$400,000:  The gold standard in this type of research is full sequencing, or RNAseq analysis, which permits allele-specific gene transcript analysis, and would include the necessary extensive bioinformatic analyses (most complete identification of the changes that have occurred in women with breast cancer protection, and how this differs from women without protection).

>$400,000:  Begin the process of applying the identified protective changes to all women (many doors to funding will likely have opened by this point).

story:
$1,500 will change a young girl's life from one of constant pain/handicap back to a normal, active teenager!

Life has not been easy for 16-year-old Mai.  As a child, she spent years in the Hanoi "homeless camp" (jail) for begging.  Her mother has been in and out of jail for heroin use and doesn't care for the kids.  Her father died of AIDS, leaving her the primary provider for her two younger siblings. 

In November, she was involved in a motorbike accident that badly injured her left knee and broke her leg.  She is now in constant pain and unable to walk properly.  Without surgery, she will be permanently impaired.  She desperately needs your help!

Families In Vietnam is a U.S. 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. All donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law!

story:
Help2Heal was inspired by 9-year old Mason Israel who brings first aid supplies to school everyday so he can patch up anyone who gets hurt.  Mason realized that everyone at his school can afford first aid supplies but some kids in other parts of the world cannot.  Mason set out with his parents, Rob and Renee, to help people around the world heal.

Mason Israel patching up one of his friends.

Project C.U.R.E. delivers each bandage Help2Heal donates to resource limited communities in 130 different developing countries around the world.  Help2Heal has already donated over 100,000 bandages through Project C.U.R.E. and hopes to have donated over 1,000,000 in the next 12 months.

“Project C.U.R.E. is thrilled to partner with Help2Heal™ in caring for kids and families in need around the world.  Something as simple as a sterile bandage can make the difference between healing and a life threatening infection. This program is a much needed addition to help us continue our work in touching lives all over the world in a very tangible way." 
 - Douglas Jackson, President and CEO of Project C.U.R.E.


Help2Heal is creating the opportunity for parents and children across America to turn an "owie" into an opportunity to help someone else, changing the conversation from "me to we."

 The Israel family with the Project C.U.R.E. team

Help2Heal is starting simple with an inaugural line of adhesive bandages that are fun to wear and even more fun to give.  With your help, we will be able to add other  critical first aid supplies to our "buy one, give one" offering as well as improve our website so we can grow our presence and help more people heal. 



         

We understand that not everyone can contribute monetary donations, and that's okay! Here are some other ways you can help:

Spread the word about our brand by word of mouth and using the Indiegogo share tools! 

Ask us about how you can use our adhesive bandage line for FUNdraising! 

Volunteer at a Project C.U.R.E. warehouse near you because they can never get enough help!
